subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Use of half-letters
msgSnippet: I just sat down and wrote the word out without looking at your description and the natural way I wrote this was: half-1, 25,28, half-12, 36, 23, half-3. Moira
messageBody:
I just sat down and wrote the word out without looking at your description and the natural way I wrote this was:

half-1, 25,28, half-12, 36, 23, half-3.

Moira

On 17/09/2007, ronwcameron <ronwcameron@...> wrote:

Forgive me if this topic has already been covered. I did a brief
search of the forum and didn't find anything that specifically
addressed the topic.

My question regards the use of half-letters within a word. I
understand that beginning or ending a word with a half-letter is fine,
but is it good style to use them intermedially?

For example, in spelling /present/, one could use:

half-pea roe et half-zoo utter no tea (half-1, 25, 28, half-12, 36, 23, 3)

I'm curious how many of you would employ a half-letter in this scenario.




--
Moira O'Brien
